name: Hampton Inn & Suites Reagan National Airport

reviews.title: Great Stay at the Hampton Inn
reviews.text: This past summer my wife and I spent 4 fun-filled days touring Washington DC. We chose this hotel because it was close to the metro and we have stayed at other Hampton Inns in NY and MD. The location of this hotel is excellent. It is only a few minutes away from the metro and a few stops away from all of the tourist attractions in Washington. If you come here by car you have to pay for parking as you do at most hotels down here.

reviews.title: Excellent Everything
reviews.text: We had a king room with a mini fridge which was great to store snacks and cold drinks. We had a fifth floor room away from the elevators. It was very quiet. You could not hear other guests or any traffic below.The room was a good size for just the two of us and the bathroom was medium sized. It had a hairdryer and had the personal necessities (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, etc.) It had a pool which we did not use because we were running around sightseeing every day. The area is very nice. It is situated among other hotels and high rise apartment buildings. It is a very safe area.

reviews.title: Good stay at the Hampton Inn
reviews.text: The staff was very courteous and helpful. The breakfast was sufficient for our needs .We are not big breakfast eaters. You could have scrambled eggs each morning with waffles and something that was like an egg McMuffin. You also had a choice of English muffins, regular muffins like chocolate chip and blueberry and donuts. They also had fresh fruits and yogurt. There was coffee, tea and orange or apple juice. We got a good price for this hotel and are planning to stay at the same hotel in the spring.

reviews.title: Hampton doesn't disappoint, yet again!
reviews.text: I have no complaints, room was huge for a standard king room, but from what I've read "standard" room size varies. Staff was very courteous and helpful anytime we needed them. Very short walk from the metro, listen to the other reviewers, best way to the metro is out the back door, down Eads toward the Marriott Crystal Gateway and then a right on 18th ST. We took the metro from the airport got off and took the long way and had to cross the huge intersection of 20th ST & Jefferson Davis.

reviews.title: Immaculately clean rooms
reviews.text: The biggest downfall is the breakfast area. Yes its small. This is not the staff's/hotel's issue but with the lack of tables in the breakfast area people were spread out all over the lobby eating and weren't picking up after themselves and the staff couldn't keep up with the amount of inconsiderate people staying there. There were plates and half eaten food on each coffee table =/

reviews.title: Good hotel
reviews.text: This is a good hotel. One of the better properties in the DC area, though somewhat off the beaten path in Crystal City.

reviews.title: Suprisingly impressed
reviews.text: Stayed one night. No frills hotel but pretty good standard regardless. Located close to the airport with free shuttle, free (basic) breakfast, free internet. Upgraded to Suite on checkin. Comfortable bed, and decent bathroom. Had room service from the neighbouring "sister" hotel with reasonable choice and quality. Finally, I got a great rate on the hilton website. Did the trick for me. I would recommend.

reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel! Incredible Service!
reviews.text: Usually stay at full service hotels, but we decided to stay at this hotel to do some sightseeing. Hotel was clean, vclean, clean, and the staff was amazing! We WILL return to this hotel on our next trip to the area.

reviews.title: Good choice, convenient location
reviews.text: Just returned from 4 nights at this hotel. We chose it based on the good reviews and proximity to the Metro for visiting the sites in DC. The hotel was clean and comfortable. We had a room on the 7th floor facing Eads St.. This hotel is in a busy area so traffic noise can be heard. The Crystal City Metro stop is a short walk as are restaurants and shops. We did use the parking garage but once we parked the car we didn't touch it until we left. The garage was adequate, kind of small spaces, and a bargain at $12.00 a night. The room had a microwave and refrigerator. The only complaint was the small breakfast area. The first morning (Monday) was extremely crowded and the server was having a hard time keeping up. The breakfast was nothing special. The usual cereals, muffins, breads, fruit and yogurts. A couple of hot items such as sausages and egg patties. One morning was french toast sticks. The front desk staff was friendly and made a couple of good restaurant suggestions withing walking distance. Jaleo, a Spanish tapas restaurant that had a happy hour with reduced prices on drinks and tapas and Pizzaiola, a pizza and Italian food casual restaurant. The first night we stumbled upon Ted's Montana Grill. Big mistake. The worst meal of our trip. Very greasy steak, mushy green beans, and expensive for the poor quality.

reviews.title: BEST HOTEL IN THE ENTIRE D.C. AREA!!
reviews.text: We would definitely stay in this hotel again if we were to return to the DC area.

Stayed here for a combination conference and leisure trip -- it wasn't the "official" conference hotel, but was only 10 minutes' walk from it, and had far more to offer (free breakfast, free WiFi, better proximity to transit, lower prices overall). We got exactly what we asked for when we reserved: a quiet room on a high floor -- we were at the back of the hotel, not overlooking the busy Jefferson Davis Highway, and far from the elevator. The room wasn't enormous, but was spacious enough, and it was nice to have a bathroom with a bit of space to it. We had to ask three times to have feather pillows switched out with foam -- allergies -- we made the third request after housekeeping staff had left for the day, and the desk staff did what they could to find us one foam pillow, and two more came the next morning. Other requests were handled quickly and efficiently. The breakfast buffet, included with the room fee, was an excellent deal: a wide selection of foods of all kinds available from 6 until 10 a.m. The hotel is also nicely located: a two-block walk to the Crystal City metro station which goes directly into DC on both the Blue and Yellow lines, and one stop from the Reagan National Airport. There are many shops and restaurants within walking distance, on Crystal Drive, in the Crystal City Shops, and on 23 Avenue.
reviews.title: Excellent value, great location!

reviews.text: I like this hotel. Location is great for DC area, close to Metro, running trails, airport and clean. I will say I usually stay as an award stay here and they rather treat you as if you’re a freeloader when if effect I’ve definitely “paid” for that room and its not as if they’re not charging Hilton for the room. Still really like the hotel.
reviews.title: Learn Spanish?

reviews.text: However what I found amazing on my last stay was that when I asked for foam pillows housekeeping was totally affronted that, “you no speak Espanola?!” Where are on earth am I Mexico? I regularly spend tons of time in LA and other big cities and never had that happen. I mean they were ticked. Learn English!
reviews.title: Comfortable & Clean Hotel with Indoor pool :)

reviews.text: When looking for a place in the DC area with an indoor pool (my daughter's most important specification when staying in a hotel) and convienient to METRO into DC the choices were very slim under $300 a night. This hotel looked great from the reviews so I took a shot.... Glad I did it was GREAT! My family even enjoyedthe continental Breakfast that was included( although it was difficult to find a seat (it was packed).
reviews.title: When staying in DC or Arlington, this is where I will be

reviews.text: The high marks in everything should say it all.
reviews.title: Very clean, friendly and convenient hotel - but very tiny pool with no whirlpool.

reviews.text: We would HIGHLY recommend this comfortable, affordable, fantastic hotel for use as a home base in visiting both Arlington and Washington DC. Although the purpose of our trip was, sadly, to bury my uncle, a retired Colonel in the USAF at Arlington National Cemetery, we found comfort and hospitality with the Hampton Inn. We wanted a hotel that could accomodate all of our extended family and found this to be THE PERFECT hotel. Located only 5 miles from Ronald Reagan Airport, the hotel had a free shuttle pick us up from the airport and drive us to the hotel. Once there, we were greated with warm smiles and even warmer cookies! Our rooms were spotless with bedding as requested and free wireless internet. The breakfast each morning offered a varying hot main dish--scrambled eggs, cheese omelets, french toast strips, etc along with standards such as yogurt, cereals, muffins, donuts, fruit and breads. Not only was this an excellent location for our sad reason for the trip but it was excellent for sightseeing around DC. Only a short walk from the Metro station, with complimentary shuttle service to the entrance of the Metro, if requested, it was super convenient for stops along the mall to see all the monuments and Smithsonian museums. The exercise room was always in use, although not by us! The pool was indoors and there was plenty of sitting room for the family to gather. The staff was very helpful in accomodating our family and even made certain cookies on request! The location was near great shopping and fantastic restaurants. Everything you need on a vacation to the nation's capital.The shuttle was also available for a complimentary return to the airport upon our departure.
reviews.title: Great Home Base for Visiting Arlington & DC

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights just after the record snow falls. Good size rooms and in-room facilities. Free high speed internet was a plus. The breakfast was adequate, but mostly carbohydrate overload on plastic plates. After the first day I stocked up on breakfast supplies from a loacl supermarket. The onsite coin laundry was a bonus and reasonably priced. Easy walk to the local metro (Crystal City) and plenty of places to eat within walking distance. Watch out for the recommended fixed price taxis to the airport. I was told by the receptionist it would be $65 plus tips plus tolls, and that this would be a cheaper option than a metered taxi during rush hour. When I got to the airport, the driver said the price was $85 + extras. I foolishly didn't confirm the price at the start of the journey so I had to pay.
reviews.title: Good size rooms and facilities

reviews.text: The Hampton Inn & Suites is a great choice for Crystal City. The property is newer than many of other hotels in the area and very convenient to the Crystal City metro station and Washington National Airport. A post office is about 1 block away and a 24 hour CVS is within walking distance. Many good restaurants are within walking distance and Pentagon City Shopping Center is one metro stop away. Parking is only $12 and WiFi is free! Rooms are very comfortable and clean. The Hampton Inn is a great choice for Crystal City.
reviews.title: Great choice for Crystal City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I live in the area but needed a place to stay for a weekday night while renovating my home. I chose this hotel because it had the most reasonable rate the night I needed it and it received good reviews on this site. I have stayed in Hampton Hotels many times before so I thought I knew what I was getting into. This place exceeded my expectations. The room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable with a great choice of pillows and nice linens. The black out curtains and "dummy" drapes were perfect. The room was quiet and the check in staff was friendly and speedy. No upscale style or fixtures but that isn't as important as a good night's sleep - which I got. The free breakfast was a great bonus. I would definately stay here again and would recommend it to my visting guests .
reviews.title: Very Impressed

reviews.text: The staff of the hotel was great! The area has plenty of good restaurants. Also, the Metro is only about 1 block always.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, close to metro

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites Reagan National Airport Hotel
